intro: Cologania martia, commonly known as the Mexican sunflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its vibrant orange to red blooms. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 3 feet, with lance-shaped leaves and showy composite flowers. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes. Cologania martia is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
